321E1CFFB48F4E6B9E0D477CB6715996.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in construction technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, technical drawings, reports, photographs of projects, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement

E56EA3928F9C4583A698C28E4B9D20D2.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the construction industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability);

81C9F1DCBE8644D68E0EBA13DA15D679.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the construction industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., reading text, document use, measurement and calculation);

E96EAFB51F1746E9AD78D60D4A097643.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the construction industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

C747E369F38A4D36ABA2F43A84799FC5.description: describe the importance of lifelong learning for careers in the construction industry;

8F230C8D640C4C93810EE4E019E2DA1F.description: identify careers in construction technology (e.g., civil or construction engineer, architectural draftsperson, renovation technician or technologist, indigenous environmental technician, project manager), and describe the education and training required for these careers;

22084C056AB9470FB76EA03ED91C4B02.description: Career Opportunities: describe career opportunities in the construction industry, and the importance of lifelong learning for these careers.

A7D57F1BBC68429BBD406063C718E4A3.description: use protective clothing, gear, and equipment appropriately (e.g., dust mask, hard hat, safety glasses, safety harness).

8D2B3839FCAF407C848CBE217E74ADD5.description: describe the rights and responsibilities of employees (e.g., the right to know, the right to refuse, the right to participate, as outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act);

9765ABF7995B4040AFDE8411A7E5B741.description: use, handle, and store materials in accordance with Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) guidelines;

026326113F184FA986AE7441F69365AC.description: outline and comply with health and safety legislation and practices for the construction industry (e.g., Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB] regulations, provincial labour legislation, Ontario Building Code, local by-laws);

A14B781E44D84196A48B5F2CDF0E194C.description: describe hazards related to construction materials, processes, tools, and equipment (e.g., toxic or flammable fumes from solvents, paints, varnishes, and gasoline; explosion or burns from propane; lung damage from silica; tripping or falls in unfinished buildings; shock from damaged power tools or electrical equipment), and the precautions that should be taken to avoid these hazards;

F5F2921C44FA432BB99E91A0CDECDC42.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and comply with health and safety regulations and practices specific to the construction industry

2B48CD6D2AA24B1385799A4210A9FB79.description: describe how societal and client needs (e.g., budget constraints, barrier-free access, energy efficiency, cultural practices) affect construction projects.

03DD33258BF5440EB2F25A94CFC3FBAB.description: describe factors affecting the quality of life of the occupants of residential buildings (e.g., air quality; allergens; access to schools, transit, and health care);

5A89CF04643D41C4BA1C2F6C89AAFBB8.description: describe the economic and social effects of the construction industry (e.g., land use, creation of primary and secondary jobs, transportation of equipment and materials; encroachment on Aboriginal lands);

B521A6B36B6E416A89670E02BCF126CF.description: Technology and Society: describe how society and the construction industry affect each other.

B5CD536C137E458EBB1715CED7A67DA6.description: describe the life cycle of a construction product (e.g., manufacture; installation; reuse, recycling, or disposal)

3E4557E5CC064C59AB00718872435585.description: describe ways of reducing and/or managing energy consumption in the home (e.g., smart meters, energy-efficient lighting, timers, heatrecovery ventilators);

2D8D809472CD40F498D77D44345D186A.description: describe the environmental effects of using natural and manufactured construction materials (e.g., energy use, release of toxic chemicals, disposal of manufacturing and construction waste, effects on water supply and quality);

449BB261C9F846E38DF75C6023AA1107.description: identify and describe environmentally friendly building practices (e.g., high-efficiency heating and cooling, renewable energy technologies, reuse of grey water, use of materials produced from sustainable resources);

C7D87EFAC2294EA4B3D5FFBA5620EBDA.description: plan projects and processes to minimize waste (e.g., use efficient cutting patterns, reuse and recycle leftover materials);

8FA991EBE2154A0E8A073A38DE21ECEB.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of the environmental effects of construction projects, and ways of reducing harmful effects;

B9A9D682AED64E77AFF5CB42E69B98F8.description: identify and correctly apply appropriate interior finishing materials (e.g., paint, wallpaper, trim, casing).

2E0ACDBD14784647BE5174FDBA45BA5B.description: identify and correctly apply appropriate exterior finishing materials (e.g., siding, stucco, deck stain)

3CEB926EBDA44558AF0A744F37CDDAD7.description: Finishing: correctly apply various finishes to complete residential construction projects.

9A35F6ED72AD422F903A3B8A8BF98D80.description: describe modifications to improve residential construction projects, and make these modifications where appropriate.

D234EB6AD23744BEB9511B747837A8E3.description: install various systems of a construction project (e.g., structural, electrical, plumbing, heating/ ventilation/air-conditioning, cabinetry) in accordance with codes, regulations, and standards (e.g., building code requirements for size and spacing of joists or beams, Ontario Electrical Safety Code requirements for wiring and fixtures);

1EE9B6DEE906429290DFB0277461EDC1.description: safely construct projects in accordance with the specifications for the project (e.g., technical drawings, lists of specified materials and fixtures);

61A400FF7A76496EA43CF8E20503958D.description: Fabrication and Assembly: demonstrate safe and accurate building techniques

34D6D7FE38BE4E26B07C04656D0B5F9A.description: lay out construction projects using a variety of tools and equipment (e.g., framing square, laser level, string line, plumb bob).

757DFFB714364B4186F6E57E07472C3A.description: correctly use metric and imperial measuring tools and equipment in a variety of construction projects;

3B3BE85323194EAEADEB3CAA14134764.description: demonstrate safe work practices when using hand tools, power tools, equipment, and materials;

D0C2C02B607448D9B9968E8154BCAF2D.description: Technical Skills: demonstrate appropriate technical skills, including the safe use of construction tools, equipment, and materials;

4B5085AFE4ED430193B7283E9C6327E6.description: determine lengths and diameters of fastening devices needed to assemble various construction projects (e.g., lengths and gauges of screws, nails, and staples; diameters of dowels), using appropriate metric and/or imperial units.

D2BD197C60214BCBBC931AC95E26825D.description: prepare detailed, accurate estimates of quantities and costs of materials for construction projects, using appropriate metric and/or imperial units (e.g., metres, square metres, litres, board feet, linear feet, square feet, cubic yards);

FFDFE96BE65A40599DAE41C4B7385C40.description: use the tables in Part 9 of the Ontario Building Code to determine the required sizes, spacing, and numbers of structural components (e.g., floor joists, lintels) for a construction project;

EC0F73F52F0149F694626563EC0B8729.description: determine dimensions and lay out construction projects using mathematical principles and formulas (e.g., Pythagorean theorem, volume and area formulas);

29EB90CD97924A1083A4026DFD7C40D9.description: Mathematical Skills: use the mathematical skills required in designing, laying out, and preparing estimates for construction projects.

D67AD8FB39E54879A4BAD6B41D8B6411.description: communicate accurate technical information verbally and graphically (e.g., through written instructions, sketches, and/or detail drawings).

8F5A2B6F61504D3182B107500DF6933B.description: identify and describe the types of loads (e.g., live, dead) that building codes require residential structural members (e.g., footings, foundations, floors, bearing walls, roofs, columns, beams, lintels) to withstand;

70D916D8F77A4FF284B65FF70EB41499.description: use appropriate sources to determine the technical requirements for residential construction projects (e.g., technical charts and tables, engineering reports, building codes and regulations, standards, municipal by-laws);

B5D23B4B45914760B819006BA29C4E5C.description: Using Technical Data: determine, use, and communicate accurate technical data in the design of construction projects;

60940F5B06A448DEA95B33EFA9A76974.description: modify and/or create hand-drafted and/or computer-assisted technical drawings (e.g., orthographic, isometric, plan, elevation, plumbing, cross-section), using appropriate metric and/or imperial units.

B4ED611F31D348AB9F42BBBA12E9A9BF.description: interpret technical drawings and specifications to accurately plan and lay out residential construction projects (e.g., determine dimensions, materials required, windows and door types, and locations of electrical devices and plumbing fixtures);

19C0F889C08E45EA9519FB2C232ADA3A.description: identify the symbols, abbreviations, hatchings, and other conventions used in various types of drawings of residential buildings (e.g., layout, foundation, floor plan, elevation, cross-section, detail, electrical system, mechanical system);

0BBBEEE19365462AA7B07C35331A2120.description: Technical Drawings: create and use working drawings for a variety of residential construction projects;

85E9BD4CCC694DD5B815DF756EFC0A6F.description: apply design principles (e.g., scale, proportion, contrast) when designing systems in construction projects (e.g., placement of electrical and plumbing fixtures)

451EF64C06A345FBB058093772CCF0C9.description: use models, prototypes, and/or sketches to aid in improving the design of construction projects;

E1B3D4CD4D9843659224E9BF0CC683CC.description: use appropriate problem-solving processes and techniques to address challenges related to various residential construction projects (e.g., house, cottage, shed, renovation);

B51ACAD1C14E4AF496F8617AB950A27E.description: identify the steps of a design process, and describe how the design process is used in the construction industry (e.g., preparing floor plans, designing prefabricated components; in urban planning);

B2B612F7EF9C4C76BF5B170AC604F9D6.description: Design and Planning: apply a design process and other problem-solving processes and techniques as appropriate to develop solutions for construction problems or challenges;

F8CB3A7C1F0E43319BB171822E0ABDFD.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe construction tools and equipment (e.g., tools: framing hammer, level, wire stripper, tri-square, power nailer; equipment: air compressor, cement mixer).

4B718470440D4DDE8C4D0F2A10B8AEDC.description: use correct terminology to describe construction processes and techniques (e.g., processes: joining, levelling, squaring, making plumb; techniques: toe-nailing, shimming);

785A1661CEF9416AAF5E8B67EEFD7A2F.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe materials, supplies, and structural components (e.g., materials: plywood, concrete, polyvinyl chloride [PVC] pipe, wire and cable; supplies: P-trap, ground fault circuit interrupter; structural components: footing, stud, lintel, plenum, valance, gable);

08CD31E75268412AA2AF364FDDCF8F69.description: identify the weather-related loads and stresses that a building must be designed to withstand (e.g., force of wind, snow load on roofs, expansion and contraction due to changes in temperature and humidity)

E4A9B8F367BC4FB6AB792AA22E9833D4.description: identify factors affecting the design of a foundation (e.g., drainage, soil type, load, frost penetration);

352DFC03968342FCA076BDBA1F94D1C6.description: identify and describe the reasons for selecting a particular structure and materials for a construction project (e.g., structure: wood versus steel beams; materials: asphalt shingles versus steel roofing);

EB7A56F204354E12BE9401434A16A627.description: describe human factors (e.g., function, ergonomics, aesthetics) to consider when planning aspects of a house (e.g., size, appearance, traffic flow, means of egress, use of nonallergenic materials);

F1A9B2A8DE354A61A6B374D9A2BE5A79.description: identify components of an environmentally friendly house (e.g., solar water heater, energyefficient heating and cooling systems, recycled building materials);

8AF564387A2045D4BEDC2D49DF246401.description: identify a variety of building types (e.g., residential, institutional), architectural styles (e.g., Colonial, Tudor, Victorian, Aboriginal), and construction engineering features (e.g., post and beam, keystone, steel supporting column);

9C5C473DBBC04AFCB9F7CF4FB78B1B94.description: describe the features of different types of houses (e.g., one-storey, two-storey, split-level, duplex);

20BA0A6B9729417084691D028FAA0D14.description: Design Considerations: demonstrate an understanding of design considerations for residential buildings

A03A2939A18D4A8BA0E7E55D7B6151E1.description: identify and describe modifications to building systems that would improve the quality and value of the building (e.g., upgraded ventilation, insulation, air barrier).

8ECC4477C86B493EA99D0C73AE73AF81.description: describe the relationship between structural systems and architectural elements in construction (e.g., cladding on an exterior support pier);

3B82AE39C46D41498AAD83A2FD7FBCE4.description: identify and describe the systems in a typical building (e.g., foundation, framing, electrical, plumbing, roof);

B5714317D44D446FB2289F6A48B5AEB6.description: Building Systems: demonstrate an understanding of the systems in a residential building;

D530945E3D474F26AEE23DB78140ACDC.description: identify organizations that promote sustainable building practices, and related standards (e.g., Canada Green Building Council, Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design [LEED®] certification standards).

F1CC4E089B1C4198A079B1F98EA03C78.description: describe how standards for the quality and processing of materials (e.g., lumber grades, CSA specifications for pipe and wire) affect the design of a building

9B943E4F23DB4FD1A39DDACDCC7B3730.description: identify permits and inspections required for residential construction projects (e.g., building, plumbing, electrical)

47E540105178410C95ACE80BD94FA22D.description: identify and describe standards that apply to residential construction projects (e.g., standards from the Canadian Standards Association [CSA], Underwriters Laboratories of Canada [ULC], and the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB]);

638CDA22D5094B159F7F0ADBC796844F.description: identify and describe regulations and/or bylaws that apply to the design and construction of residential buildings (e.g., municipal by-laws; zoning regulations; official plans; requirements for setbacks, easements, and barrier-free access)

9CCCF2808F584642AD2780219B6F28B8.description: describe the purpose of building codes (e.g., Ontario Building Code, Ontario Electrical Safety Code, Ontario Fire and Plumbing codes);

1B9115AB916F472AB86AB785C89C9C4B.description: Building Codes, Regulations, and Standards: describe the building codes, regulations, and standards that govern construction projects

A1FB2870205A44D78FB92AEBD77A7254.description: identify and describe structural and non-structural components of buildings (e.g., structural: footings, foundations, floors, bearing walls, columns, beams, lintels, trusses, rafters; non-structural: trim, siding, flooring).

C157366CCF6E4D57B52B9F5349F04665.description: identify and describe various residential construction processes (e.g., slip forming, insulated concrete forming, platform framing, balloon framing, assembling modular cabinetry);

C52E150CEA8A4A23B16DDB977AA481FC.description: identify and describe the processes used to produce a variety of construction materials (e.g., concrete, masonry, metal products, wood products);

AA336A058A2E498FA7C36DC352D7D3CA.description: identify and describe the properties (e.g., physical, mechanical, thermal) of common natural and manufactured building materials (e.g., natural wood, engineered wood, steel framing);

71F583A2B47744CBADA678591C596DE8.description: identify and describe the uses and features of construction materials (e.g., lumber, concrete, oriented-strand board [OSB], adhesives, finishes, hardware), tools (e.g., hammers, pliers, hand saws, circular saws, drills), and equipment (e.g., generators, scaffolds)

341FE1193AED4846A3A807BB5B7548CB.description: Materials, Processes, and Components: demonstrate an understanding of construction materials, processes, and components;
